docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 17 -- The Argentine Cabinet crisis that was precipitated Tuesday when a group of Army officers forcibly ejected Foreign Minister Alberto Gilbert from his office continues unsolved, for two important political posts in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 17 -- The Argentine Cabinet crisis that was precipitated Tuesday when a group of Army officers forcibly ejected Foreign Minister Alberto Gilbert from his office continues unsolved, for two important political posts in the Government -- that of Foreign Minister and that of Secretary to the Presidency -- have been filled only temporarily.

headline.main: ARGENTINE CLIQUES SEEK 2 KEY POSTS; Foreign Affairs and Secretary to Presidency Offices Held by Interim Appointees RAMIREZ STILL HOLDS ACE Opposition Cannot Expel Him Without the Risk of Losing Diplomatic Recognition

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 18 -- Sporadic strikes, especially in the building and metallurgical trades, broke out this morning in various parts of Argentina, according to reliable information reaching this capital. The strikes have a clear-cut...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 18 -- Sporadic strikes, especially in the building and metallurgical trades, broke out this morning in various parts of Argentina, according to reliable information reaching this capital. The strikes have a clear-cut anti-government character, being prompted more by political than by economic reasons.

headline.main: One Person Dies in Argentine Riot;; Political Friction Seen in Strikes ONE PERSON KILLED IN ARGENTINE RIOT

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YOTK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19 -- The crisis precipitated in Argentina by the coup d'etat of the Army colonels that resulted in the ousting of the Foreign Minister and the Secretary to President Pedro P. Ramirez is expected to produce clues to the position that...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19 -- The crisis precipitated in Argentina by the coup d'etat of the Army colonels that resulted in the ousting of the Foreign Minister and the Secretary to President Pedro P. Ramirez is expected to produce clues to the position that country will finally take toward the war and inter-American solidarity.

headline.main: ARGENTINA'S PLANS ARE STILL OBSCURE; State Department Awaits Clues That May Appear From Latest Coup of Army Men

docs.snippet: Gen strike called to protest against Pres Morinigo regime; natl union govt creation urged

headline.main: PARAGUAYANS STRIKE; General Walkout in Capital Is Reported in Montevideo
Argentine President Resigns Under Pressure From Army

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 25 (U.P.) -- A clique of ultra-nationalistic Argentine Army officers forced President Pedro Ramirez to resign last night and took him prisoner after threatening an armed revolt as the President was about to announce the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 25 (U.P.) -- A clique of ultra-nationalistic Argentine Army officers forced President Pedro Ramirez to resign last night and took him prisoner after threatening an armed revolt as the President was about to announce the formation of a liberal government, reports from Buenos Aires said early today.
docs.abstract: Ramirez ousted by mil group led by Perlinger and Col E Avalos; Vice Pres Farrell named Pres; Ramirez reptd forced to sign resignation at gun point; US State Dept uninformed

headline.main: Army Clique Reported in Saddle; RAMIREZ REPORTED OUSTED BY REVOLT

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 25 -- President Ramirez, in a proclamation to the Argentine people, made public at 3:30 o'clock this morning, announced that, being tired and in need of rest, he had delegated the Presidential powers to his Vice President,...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 25 -- President Ramirez, in a proclamation to the Argentine people, made public at 3:30 o'clock this morning, announced that, being tired and in need of rest, he had delegated the Presidential powers to his Vice President, General Farrell.

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 26 -- The city of Buenos Aires again has been thrown into a state of expectation, not unmixed with alarm, by the considerable volume of troop movements that occurred early this morning in the near-by military base of Campo...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 26 -- The city of Buenos Aires again has been thrown into a state of expectation, not unmixed with alarm, by the considerable volume of troop movements that occurred early this morning in the near-by military base of Campo de Mayo.

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 -- Informal consultations with the other American republics regarding the nature and significance of the sudden change of leadership of the Argentine Government on Thursday have begun, it was learned tonight, and it is believed...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 26 -- Informal consultations with the other American republics regarding the nature and significance of the sudden change of leadership of the Argentine Government on Thursday have begun, it was learned tonight, and it is believed probable that a dissolution of diplomatic relations with Argentina may result.
docs.abstract: Amer nations likely to sever relations with Farrel regime; Ramirez reptd arrested while trying to take refuge in foreign embassy; compulsory resignation confirmed; Cabinet provisional apptmts made; troop movements noted; official Brazil silent; Amer nations com expected to discuss situation

headline.main: AMERICAS CONSULT ON ARGENTINE COUP; Hemisphere Republics Likely to Sever Relations With New Farrell Regime AMERICAS CONSULT ON ARGENTINE COUP
